conclusion: Determine the speed of the bullet relative to the ground using distances and time intervals.
The distance between two adjacent bullets in the air is s.
The speed of the bullet relative to the ground is v_0.
The time interval between the firing of the bullets is Δt_0.
Express distance s in terms of speed of the bullet and time interval: s = v_0 Δt_0.
Solve for Δt_0: Δt_0 = s / v_0.
Cart A is moving to the left with a speed v_1.
Cart B is moving to the right with a speed v_2.
The speed of the bullet relative to the ground is v_0.
Determine the speed of the bullet relative to Cart B: v_bullet relative to B = v_0 - v_1.
Consider the relative motion of Cart B: v_bullet relative to ground = v_bullet relative to B + v_2 = (v_0 - v_1) + v_2 = v_0 + v_2 - v_1.
The time interval Δt_0 is the time it takes for the bullet to travel the distance s relative to the ground.
The distance s is also the distance traveled by the bullet in the time Δt_0, which is s = v_0 Δt_0.
Confirm that Δt_0 = s / v_0, verifying the consistency of the speed of the bullet relative to the ground with given conditions.
The speed of each bullet relative to the ground is v_0 + v_2 - v_1.
